question: Two vectors are said to be equal if:
option1: they have equal magnitude and same direction
option2: they have equal magnitude and opposite direction
option3: they have equal magnitude and common initial point
option4: they have equal magnitude irrespective of the direction
answer: they have equal magnitude and same direction
explanation: Two vectors are said to be equal if they have equal magnitude and same direction. Two vectors are said to be co-initial if their initial point is common.
